Parking Space We offer secure parking for all visitors including CCTV. Breakfast Prepare your own breakfast or make use of our food & drink stalls. Coffee Barista Our expert barista are located on the ranch to relax and socialize. The Gold Horse's Ranch Holland Cottage at the Gold Horses Hide Away Retreat @ TheGoldHorses Private open plan lodge, ideal for a family or guest sharing with large bathroom and open living space. Access to pool and fire pit areas set within 55 acres of the private ‚ÄòHorse Power Pavilion‚Äù Ranch. Onsite coffee shop yet only 20 minutes to the most beautiful beaches in the world. Water access for small boat or kayak. This suite has kitchenette area with microwave and fridge freezer. Ample parking and a real feel of peace and tranquillity. Relax and unwind at our beautiful property. 1 Bedroom Sleeps 4 From $200 per night Holland Cottage at the Gold Horses Private 1 bedroom suite with large bathroom and open living space. Access to pool and fire pit areas set within 55 acres of the private ‚ÄòHorse Power Pavilion‚Äù Ranch. Onsite coffee trailer yet only 20 minutes to the most beautiful beaches on the emerald coast. Water access for small boat or kayak. This suite has kitchenette area with microwave and fridge freezer. Ample parking and a real feel of peace and tranquillity out in the countryside. Relax and unwind at our beautiful property. 1 Bedroom Sleeps 2 From $200 per night 0 Miles From the city centre 0 -Acre Outdoor activity centre 0 five star rating 0 international guests Airbnb Reviews This was a delightful cottage!  Loads of room, great AC, very accommodating and delicious food on site. We will definitely return for Kate‚Äôs hospitality! Lisa June 30, 2022 Read the reviews closely. What you see is sort of what you get. This stay felt like an April Fool‚Äôs Joke. I was Leary how Kate always has a response ... read more for every review but never acknowledges any concerns. I have requested my cleaning fee back and am still waiting. The two positives were the pool and how close it was to the beach. We woke up Uber early after very little sleep and headed out ASAP to be on the sand. The hot rub doesn‚Äôt seem to work. The WiFi code is not listed on the guest access sign in the unit and the link not work on the site. There was no way to join and no service there. Jan June 25, 2022 Loved staying in this private hideaway. The pavilion being on property made the trip fun and the food was great. Super easy drive to the beach on the side with ... read more no toll bridge. Loved this place. Parker June 24, 2022 Great location, setting and accommodations!  Close enough to activities and yet allowed us to unwind away from the hustle and bustle.  Very clean and nicely decorated.  Host ... read more is very responsive!!  Thank you and we hope to come back soon Kirk June 20, 2022 This is a nice quiet area. I was visiting my son and Kate‚Äôs place was just down the street from where he lives so the location was very convenient. There ... read more was a little mixup on the check in time but it was all resolved quickly. Unfortunately the food truck, coffee shop etc wasn‚Äôt open during our stay but I hear that it‚Äôs great. I hope to be able to return and experience it all. Kelly June 15, 2022 Lovely stay, nice facility. Kate was exceptional Sheilla June 12, 2022 Everything was great inside the cottage! The farm is beautiful and we especially loved Kate‚Äôs story about moving to the US and building this dream! Jessica June 9, 2022 This is a nice little place! Open floor plan with lots of space to move around. Kendall May 14, 2022 Perfect little cottage to get away for a little while ! Harold April 9, 2022 A delightful and comfortable cottage. Especially enjoyed sitting outside by pool in the mornings. A special treat was the Pavilion where we could enjoy delicious  fish & chips, brisket ... read more burgers and libations a couple times a week.  Good location for getting quickly to beaches without heavy traffic. Lynn April 8, 2022 Loved our stay!! On site food was amazing ü§© Delavon March 29, 2022 Very clean Great for a couple Spacious shower Nice land Great service Vincent March 20, 2022 Great location and the perfect space for my solo beach trip! Directions could have been tricky if Kate didn't provide such clarity here  I also loved that the cottage ... read more had a vanity! Jasmine December 6, 2021 Our stay was great and the cottage was very cute and clean. It wouldn't have been absolutely amazing amazing had the coffee shop and and food court been open. Juanita November 14, 2021 I booked this cottage for my parents so they could be close to my home while they were visiting. From the beginning Kate was so accommodating and quick to answer ... read more any questions I had. My parents were impressed by how clean and comfortable it was there. My mother said it was peaceful and a nice change of scenery for them. I would recommend this place to any one visiting the area and next time my parents come to town I hope the cottage is available. Ericka November 4, 2021 Kate's place is wonderful, quiet, clean and close to everything.  Definately a great place to stay and will be back! Laura Collins - Laura October 20, 2021 We loved staying here. We had never been to the area but the location was close enough to everything that it wasn't a big deal to get out if we ... read more needed something or wanted to go anywhere. The beaches are close by as well so that was nice. The host left brochures and booklets of things to do in the area that even had coupons so there were plenty of options for activities in the area. GPA takes you straight to the location. The only part we found difficult was when we got there figuring out where to go to get to the cottage, bjt kate did a wonderful job at explaining which way to go. It was very private considering the location has a bar, coffee shop, food trucks, and a future restaurant on site. These things were really neat to have there because we could walk to the bar. They even had a band playing one night which was cool. Loved talking with Kate. Made me miss being in England. It was a great experience and stay. We loved it! Breanna October 11, 2021 Very convenient and accessible for the area I was visiting. The accommodations were very nice and comfortable. Sandra K October 1, 2021 Excellent place to stay we had a great time. Daniel September 19, 2021 Beautiful and charming location. Make sure you get the Fish and Chips from the food truck and bring water/coffee if you check in late, no store is open late. ... read more /> Great communication, clean, private, it was great! Adam September 12, 2021 Really nice place way larger and more convenient than a hotel.  it is really nice to have a pool and not have kids running everywhere.  It was peaceful ... read more and and a very good experience.  I will.say the dock pictured is in needof repair I dont know how many people plan on using it. I do wish the small refrigerator was bigger or on a having back issues it was hard to reach. All in all very nice place 30 minutes to the beach maybe 10 to supermarket and restaurants we would stay again for sure. Lawrence September 7, 2021 The service on the way is horrible. Other wise it was a great place to stay, I wish we could‚Äôve stayed longer. Kate was very nice and allowed my bf ... read more and I to bring our 2 small dogs. It was a last minute request since we evacuated from our area due to a hurricane. Really interesting ceiling fan in bedroom that worked with a remote was the j my frustrating thing about our stay. Chrishonna September 5, 2021 I needed a place to flee from Ida. It was fine for that. However it is very basic. NO INTERNET even though it was advertised. It felt like she wasn't ... read more quite ready to host guest yet. There's very little furniture even though the space was quite large. Kate seems to have spotty cell service so communications were difficult. As long as your expectations aren't very high it was fine. Clean and neat. Betsy September 1, 2021 Horrible communication from the very start with Kate. I booked the air bnb (for a week) two days prior to check in and the day before check in messaged Kate ... read more to see if I could shorten my stay by 3 days but keep check in and everything else the same. I was down here with my one and three year old to visit their dad as he has been down here trucking the past couple weeks. He got notice the day before check in they would be sending him home early. I never heard from Kate and had to get an air bnb representative to contact her in order for her to finally text me back from her personal phone 3 hours before check in. She blamed it on the app update as to why she hadn‚Äôt contacted me back even though I called and texted her personal phone as well. Then she claimed because it wasn‚Äôt a week prior to check in she couldn‚Äôt change the dates of my stay. So I called air bnb thinking it was an issue on their end. They were very helpful and supportive and tried getting her to agree to changing the dates but she wouldn‚Äôt because she said it wasn‚Äôt what she considered to be a situation that would require the change and a partial refund. Kate was extremely rude in the whole matter and honestly just very snakey with the whole way she tried to put the blame on air bnb for the reason she wasn‚Äôt contacting me and why she couldn‚Äôt change the dates. Would not recommend booking with her. I‚Äôve never had such a horrible experience with a host. Very disappointing. Hannah August 28, 2021 Overall great place to stay! The pool was nice, we got to go to Destin, PCB, and Santa Rosa during our stay. Not too far from the beach, just beware ... read more there‚Äôs not great cell service once you‚Äôre on HWY-20. Kate was super friendly and helpful. Will definitely be coming back to Freeport, hopefully to this same AirBNB! Only downside was the small fridge and lack of stove (but that‚Äôs not a big deal if you plan on eating out a ton anyway)! Noah August 23, 2021 This home was so beautiful and absolutely everything in the pictures!‚ù§Ô∏è Kate was an amazing host and communicated so kindly and quickly! It‚Äôs close to anything you could possibly need ... read more and also close to the beach! I would completely recommend this Airbnb and I would absolutely stay here again! Carijn August 6, 2021 Great location and very close to the beach! Price was very reasonable for that area. Rob July 28, 2021 Great location and very close to the beach! Price was very reasonable for that area. Rob And Dawn July 28, 2021 I really enjoyed my stay at ‚ÄúThe Holland Cottage‚Äù. It was very clean and spacious! Kate was really nice and welcoming I will not stay anywhere else when I come ... read more back to Destin! LaShonda July 26, 2021 Pools was dirty and had crabs crawling around the bottom. The courtyard needed weeding as did the area around the outside of the unit. Landscape lighting around the courtyard was ... read more all broken and falling over so it was extremely dark at night. The road going into the place was really rough and full of potholes. It needed maintenance as well. Hard to find the unit at night with no lighting or directional signs. One small sign on the front beside the door but you actually pull up to the unit on the side so its impossible to see. Lots of storage boats, RVs, and other miscellaneous "stuff". Looked a little junky.  It just seems like the exterior has been neglected.  Its ashamed because it could be a really cool place. Inside was nice and comfortable. Unit was clean and well stocked(pots, pans, and cooking utensils). AC worked great and bed was clean and comfortable. Living room and bedroom were very spacious and had double doors that closed off for privacy. The vaulted ceiling was a nice touch that made it seem even larger. Good water pressure and ample hot water. Shower could use a good scrubbing. Had soap scum on the trays. I never did complain or ask for anything. I just thought that the exterior maintenance items should have been addressed without someone pointing the out.  Clearly if you have a grounds keeper they would see the pool full of debris and the weeds all over. Room was fairly cheap so I guess I got what I paid for. It would have been nice to take a dip in the pool though. Marty July 23, 2021 Kate‚Äôs space is amazing. The property is perfect for walking around and relaxing. The pool was a great bonus. Loved the people we met and the stay. Kaye and the ... read more Mayor were so great as well, making sure we had what we needed and checking in! Would absolutely come back! Samantha & Devin June 19, 2021 This airbnb is wonderful! The owner kate is amazing, and the location itself is super unique, quiet, and comfortable. We will be sure to stay here again on our future ... read more trips back home to fl. Austin May 22, 2021 Kates place is shiny clean, beautiful surroundings, lovely pool and patio  Comfy bed. So quiet too! Kaysee May 18, 2021 Beautiful listing but would only revisit if communication improved with host about basic things, better cleaning and dusting done, and adequate WiFi information were provided. Daniela May 10, 2021 This is a hidden gem, quiet, spacious and clean.Great hospitality and amenities. Fred and Kate are super host. Great little coffee shop. Marvingillman May 8, 2021 The barn is a nice space to stay in Freeport. It's decor was darling and very "Florida" and the bed is a step up from a motel. The pool is ... read more sparkling clean, but the area around it needs some love. The weather did not permit us to enjoy the pool this trip but maybe next time. On the Friday night that they were there, there looked to be something fun going on by the coffee shop with food and I think music, however we did not know about it ahead of time so we were not able to plan accordingly... maybe we can next time. Kerry April 24, 2021 Enjoyed our stay! Would visit again! Genesis April 19, 2021 We had a great time at the Holland Cottage! The place is very spacious and close enough to all the attractions.  Kate is an amazing host!  We would ... read more definitely stay there again. Sara April 4, 2021 Great place to stay!! Valerie March 31, 2021 Kate is a fantastic host! We enjoyed visiting with her and staying in Holland Cottage. The new Horse Power Pavilion is amazing! Mary March 21, 2021 I had to make a last minute trip to the Ft Walton area and someone suggested this place. It looked great and was available so I booked it. I was ... read more scheduled to stay for 2 nights. On the day of my trip on Sunday morning , my flight left almost 2 hours late and I made sure to message Kate right away. When I arrived at my connecting city the flight had been delayed and eventually cancelled. I tried to reroute my flight through every possible airport however the soonest AA could fly me was on Tuesday night. I messaged Kate feeling everything that had happened. She showed absolutely no empathy and when I asked her if I could use the reservation at a later date or get some sort of refund she did not reply. I asked her once again and didn‚Äôt grant my request. She only offered to waive the 80 dollar cleaning fee if I booked again. I was blown away by the lack of empathy and understanding from this host. I lost $330 on this reservation because of a circumstances beyond my control. Not very nice of host to do this. She could have at least refund√© me one night and the cleaning few which she also charged her following guest. I‚Äôd think twice about staying here. Ximena March 2, 2021 Kates place was very clean and close to everything I needed while traveling for work Christie February 23, 2021 Wery nice spacious  efficency type cabin that is a notch above a motel room. If the weather is nice the dock and pool would be fun. The hostess was ... read more great, very prompt to answer any questions. Caroline February 16, 2021 Privately tucked into a beautiful landscape. Leslie January 22, 2021 This is a hidden gem, quiet, spacious and clean.Great hospitality and amenities. Fred and Kate are super host. Great little coffee shop. Marvingillman May 8, 2021 The barn is a nice space to stay in Freeport. It's decor was darling and very "Florida" and the bed is a step up from a motel. The pool is ... read more sparkling clean, but the area around it needs some love. The weather did not permit us to enjoy the pool this trip but maybe next time. On the Friday night that they were there, there looked to be something fun going on by the coffee shop with food and I think music, however we did not know about it ahead of time so we were not able to plan accordingly... maybe we can next time. Kerry April 24, 2021 Enjoyed our stay! Would visit again! Genesis April 19, 2021 We had a great time at the Holland Cottage! The place is very spacious and close enough to all the attractions.  Kate is an amazing host!  We would ... read more definitely stay there again. Sara April 4, 2021 Great place to stay!! Valerie March 31, 2021 Kate is a fantastic host! We enjoyed visiting with her and staying in Holland Cottage. The new Horse Power Pavilion is amazing! Firm Groundswell Design Group , Neumann/Smith Architecture area / size 3,700 sqft Year 2024 Location Detroit , Michigan , United States , Type Restaurant , Hamilton‚Äôs, nestled within The Godfrey Detroit, stands in homage to the legacy of Hamilton Carhartt, whose factory once thrived on this historic site. Spanning nearly 3,700 square feet, the restaurant offers seating for 93 guests indoors, complemented by an outdoor patio accommodating an additional 38 patrons. The design accentuates the 14-foot ceilings, harmonizing warm wood tones with contrasting cool color palettes. Key design elements include intricate millwork, refined walnut accents, antique brass fixtures, plush tufted furniture, mosaic tile flooring, and quartzite and quartz tabletops. Details including custom statement lighting create an immersive dining experience that honors Carhartt‚Äôs legacy and celebrates the vibrant history of Corktown. Brand New Treetop Adventure+ just launched at Go Ape Bracknell and Go Ape Leeds Castle. Easy 1 - 5 hours 25 Fish & Chips Nestled within the vibrant and eclectic Horse Power Pavilion at a sprawling ranch in Destin, Florida, Nana Betties Fish and Chips trailer brings a slice of classic British cuisine to the sunny shores of the Gulf Coast. This quaint and charming food trailer, named with affection and nostalgia, evokes the comforting tastes of traditional English fish and chips, a beloved dish that has transcended borders and found fans worldwide.

Nana Betties is more than just a food trailer; it's a culinary experience steeped in tradition. The name itself conjures images of a beloved grandmother's kitchen, where recipes are passed down through generations and meals are prepared with love and care. The trailer's decor is quintessentially British, with Union Jack bunting and rustic wooden elements that add to its charm. The aroma of freshly fried fish and chips wafts through the air, drawing in locals and tourists alike who seek a taste of authentic British fare.

The menu at Nana Betties is simple yet meticulously crafted. The star of the show is the classic fish and chips ‚Äì tender, flaky fish encased in a golden, crispy batter, served alongside thick-cut chips that are perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection. Each serving is accompanied by a wedge of lemon and a generous portion of tartar sauce, providing the perfect balance of flavors. For those looking to explore beyond the traditional, Nana Betties also offers variations such as battered sausages, mushy peas, and pickled onions, all staples of a British chippy.

What sets Nana Betties apart is not just its dedication to authenticity but also its commitment to quality. The fish is sourced fresh, and the batter is made using a secret family recipe that ensures a light yet crispy texture. The chips are hand-cut and double-fried to achieve the perfect crunch on the outside and a fluffy interior. This attention to detail has earned Nana Betties a loyal following and rave reviews from patrons who appreciate the genuine taste of England in the heart of Florida.

Located at the Horse Power Pavilion, a dynamic venue known for its blend of food, music, and community events, Nana Betties is a beloved fixture. The pavilion itself is a hub of activity, hosting everything from live music performances to farmers' markets, making it the perfect spot for a casual meal. Visitors can enjoy their fish and chips at picnic tables under the pavilion's shaded areas or take their meal to go and explore the beautiful ranch surroundings.

In essence, Nana Betties Fish and Chips trailer offers more than just a meal ‚Äì it provides a nostalgic journey to the cobbled streets of England, where the simple pleasure of fish and chips is a cherished tradition. Whether you're a Brit longing for a taste of home or a curious foodie eager to try something new, Nana Betties at the Horse Power Pavilion in Destin promises an unforgettable culinary experience. Executive Team  | HP¬Æ Official Site Skip to Content Skip to Footer Skip to Country Selector Laptops Laptops Laptop Deals Featured Laptop Subscriptions AI PCs Top Rated Laptops Laptops for Home Laptops for Work Mobile Workstations Laptops for Gaming Desktops Desktops Desktop Deals Featured Monitors Top Rated Desktops Desktops for Home Desktops for Work Workstations Desktops for Gaming Printers Printers Printer Deals Featured Print Subscriptions Instant Ink Scanners Printers for Home Printers for Work Ink, Toner & Paper Large-Format Printers & Plotters Accessories Accessories Weekly Deals Featured HyperX Monitors Computer Accessories Gaming Accessories Video & Voice Accessories Care Packs & Services Subscriptions Subscriptions HP All-In Plan HP Instant Ink HP Laptop Subscriptions OMEN Gaming Subscriptions Business Solutions Business Solutions Featured Workforce Experience Platform HP Z Workstations & Solutions Video & Voice Collaboration Government & Education The Future of Work Software & Services Computers Printers & Digital Presses Support Support Featured Support by Product Parts Store Support & Troubleshooting Software & Drivers Check Warranty Contact Us Your Cart is Empty Support See all Skip to Content Skip to Footer us en false https://www.hp.com/cma/ng/lib/exceptions/privacy-banner.js Executive leadership Enrique Lores President & Chief Executive Officer Karen Parkhill Chief Financial Officer Alex Cho President, Personal Systems Anneliese Olson President of HP Inc. Imaging, Printing, and Solutions Dave Shull President, HP Solutions Dave McQuarrie Chief Commercial Officer Julie Jacobs Chief Legal Officer & General Counsel Antonio Lucio Chief Marketing¬†& Corporate Affairs Officer Carol Surface Chief People Officer Ernest Nicolas Chief Enterprise Operations Officer Tuan Tran President, Technology¬†& Innovation Enrique Lores President & Chief Executive Officer Enrique Lores is the President and CEO of HP Inc., a global technology leader empowering its customers to shape their own ways of working. With operations in over 170 countries, HP delivers innovative experiences that enable growth and fulfillment for individuals and businesses everywhere. Since becoming CEO in November 2019, Enrique has spearheaded a bold strategy to position HP for the future, emphasizing a growth-oriented portfolio, digital transformation, and exceptional talent development. Under Enrique‚Äôs leadership, HP has been recognized with several prestigious awards, including Fortune‚Äôs World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies, Barron's 100 Most Sustainable Companies, JUST Capital‚Äôs Just 100 List, and The Wall Street Journal‚Äôs Best-Managed Companies. With a career spanning 35 years at HP, Enrique has held senior leadership roles across the company‚Äôs Personal Systems, Print, Industrial, and Services businesses in various global, regional, and country-specific capacities. Notably, he led the Separation Management Office during the 2015 split of the Hewlett-Packard Company, one of the most complex corporate separations in history. In the leadership role, he streamlined HP‚Äôs cost structure, simplified the organization, and opened new avenues for innovation and growth. Enrique is also active in several influential organizations, serving as Chair of the PayPal Board and participating in the International Advisory Boards of the Atlantic Council, Esade Business School, and San Telmo Business School. He is also a member of the Business Roundtable, the Welcome.US CEO Council, and the World Economic Forum‚Äôs International Business Council and Alliance of CEO Climate Leaders. Enrique began his career as an HP intern after earning his degree in electrical engineering from the Polytechnic University of Valencia (UPV) and an MBA from Esade Business School. In 2024, UPV recognized Enrique as an "honoris causa" doctor for his commitment to lifelong learning, technical knowledge, and business success. He is based in Palo Alto, California. Anneliese Olson President of HP Inc. Imaging, Printing, and Solutions Anneliese Olson is the President of HP Inc. Imaging, Printing and Solutions, a global business that delivers services, software, and hardware for home, office, and graphics markets. As head of the global business unit, Anneliese is leading the transformation of HP‚Äôs imaging and printing business to enhance the printing experience and empower customers to thrive in the future of work. Since beginning her career at HP as an intern, Anneliese has held a variety of leadership positions across the company, spanning product development, P&L management, product marketing, and go-to-market strategy. Anneliese brings a wealth of international experience, having lived and worked in HP offices in Asia and the U.S. Most recently she served as Senior Vice President and Managing Director, North America Market, where she led go-to-market strategy, sales, execution, and multibillion-dollar P&L for the company‚Äôs largest revenue-generating region. A passionate advocate for leadership, sustainability, and inclusion initiatives, Anneliese holds a Sustainable Capitalism certificate from the Berkeley Law Executive Education Program and is a Senior Fellow of the American Leadership Forum Silicon Valley. She actively mentors emerging talent and is a sought-after speaker on unlocking human potential. Anneliese also advises several start-ups and holds Board positions with non-profit organizations, including the Board of Regents at Santa Clara University and the Board of Trustees for the Monterey Bay Aquarium. Anneliese earned a Bachelor of Science in Marketing from Santa Clara University and is based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Karen Parkhill Chief Financial Officer Karen Parkhill is Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer (CFO) for HP Inc. As CFO, she serves as a strategic advisor to the business and is responsible for leading HP‚Äôs global Finance organization and all aspects of financial operations including accounting and controls, financial planning and analysis, business decision support, tax, audit, treasury, mergers and acquisitions, corporate development, and investor relations. Karen is a seasoned, world class finance leader with 30 years of experience across healthcare and financial services sectors. Prior to joining HP in August 2024, she served as CFO for well-established, publicly traded companies for the past 13 years. Most recently she was CFO of Medtronic, a global healthcare technology company where she led its finance organization and key support functions. At Medtronic, Karen also served as executive sponsor of the company‚Äôs PRIDE Employee Resource Group and Women‚Äôs Vice President Network supporting senior women leadership development. Karen began her career in investment banking at JP Morgan, where she gained invaluable global experience in M&A and Capital Markets. She rose through the ranks at JP Morgan and ultimately became Chief Financial Officer for Commercial Banking where she served for five years. Following JP Morgan, Karen moved to Comerica Incorporated, where she was Vice Chairman and Chief Financial Officer. She also currently serves on the board of American Express, where she chairs the Risk Committee. Karen earned bachelor's degrees in business administration and mathematics from Southern Methodist University in Dallas and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. She is a 2012 recipient of the SMU Cox School of Business Distinguished Alumni Award and a 2008 recipient of the University of Chicago Booth School of Business Distinguished Young Alumna Award. Alex Cho President, Personal Systems Alex Cho is the President of Personal Systems at HP Inc. He leads a global business of $35 billion, including a technology portfolio of PCs, displays, peripherals, conference room and software solutions. Alex is responsible for delivering computing experiences and solutions that enable people to work, learn, play and connect in a hybrid world. A 28-year veteran of HP, Alex has served in multiple strategy and operational positions spanning the company‚Äôs PC, Printing and Services business in the Americas, Europe and globally. Most recently, he served as Vice President and General Manager of HP‚Äôs Commercial PC business with worldwide P&L responsibility for commercial notebooks, desktop computing, accessories and displays businesses. Over the course of his career, Alex has led HP‚Äôs LaserJet Supplies and Installed Base business globally, driving strategy, development and execution for the multi-billion-dollar printing supplies category. He has also served as Vice President for LaserJet Printers and Supplies in the Americas region and worked in Europe managing HP‚Äôs Software Management Services category. Alex holds a B.S. in Industrial Engineering and an M.S. in Engineering and Industrial Management from Stanford University. He is based in Palo Alto, California, with his wife and four children. Julie Jacobs Chief Legal Officer & General Counsel Julie Jacobs serves as Chief Legal Officer and General Counsel for HP Inc. In this role, Julie leads the worldwide Global Legal Affairs organization, including all aspects of legal and government affairs, brand security, compliance and ethics. Julie is an accomplished executive with over two decades of experience in the global technology and media industry. She is a business-focused General Counsel and a strategic and analytical thinker and problem solver with extensive experience resolving complex litigation and regulatory matters and advising boards of directors and executive teams. Julie also has extensive experience in structuring, negotiating and closing strategic transactions, most notably leading the acquisition of AOL by Verizon in 2015, orchestrating the integration of Yahoo & AOL in 2017 and negotiating the acquisition of Yahoo by Apollo Global Management in 2021. Prior to HP, Julie was Senior Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary of Yahoo Inc., a global technology and media company with a dynamic house of brands, including Yahoo (Yahoo Mail, Yahoo.com, Yahoo Finance, Yahoo News and Yahoo Sports) and AOL (AOL Mail and AOL.com). In that role, she was responsible for leading the Legal, Regulatory, Government Relations, Corporate Secretary and Compliance functions for Yahoo following Apollo Global Management's acquisition of Yahoo in September 2021. Prior to this, Julie was Executive Vice President and General Counsel of Verizon Media and AOL. Julie has a Bachelor of Science degree in finance from the University of Colorado, Boulder, and a Juris Doctor from Georgetown University Law Center. Julie will split her time between Washington D.C. and Palo Alto. Antonio Lucio Chief Marketing¬†& Corporate Affairs Officer Antonio Lucio is Chief Marketing and Corporate Affairs Officer at HP Inc. Antonio rejoined HP in 2024, having served as Chief Marketing and Communications Officer after the separation of Hewlett-Packard Company in 2015. Under his leadership, the company reframed its vision, mission, and brand while growing revenue and market share. Throughout his career, Antonio has been successful in driving growth by building businesses, brands, and marketing teams that have stood the test of time, working with some of the most recognized companies and iconic brands across multiple industries. In addition to HP, he has held Global CMO roles for Meta and Visa and the role of Chief Innovation and Portfolio Transformation Officer for PepsiCo. A prominent thought leader in marketing transformation, Antonio has earned accolades including induction into the American Advertising Federation Hall of Fame (2023), the Forbes Most Influential CMOs Hall of Fame (2022), and the American Marketing Association Hall of Fame (2022). He stands out as one of the few to receive all three prestigious honors, marking him as a leading figure in the field. Antonio is an advocate for diversity, equity, and inclusion. His efforts have been recognized by ANA/AIMM, AdColor, Adweek, and PRWeek, among others. He is the co-founder of Virtuosi LEAP, a development program designed to advance marketing practice through transformational leadership skills and DEI. He also serves as an Executive Fellow at Yale SOM and mentors some of the world's leading CMOs. Born in Spain and raised in Puerto Rico, Antonio earned his bachelor‚Äôs degree in history from Louisiana State University. He is based in Palo Alto, California. Carol Surface Chief People Officer Carol Surface is the Chief People Officer at HP. She works across the company to drive growth, innovation and organizational effectiveness, by enabling the power of HP‚Äôs people.¬† She leads the global talent, culture and Human Resources strategy, which includes workforce and organization effectiveness, total rewards, talent acquisition, people and leadership development, employee experience and HR operations. Carol joined HP in 2025 and brings unparalleled expertise in building high-performance, purpose-driven teams to deliver exceptional business results. Most recently, she served as Chief People Officer at Apple. Prior to that, Carol spent a decade as Chief Human Resources Officer at Medtronic, a global healthcare technology leader, where she led transformation initiatives, including the evolution of its HR operating model. Carol also served as Chief Human Resources Officer at Best Buy, and she held HR leadership roles for PepsiCo in New York, Hong Kong and Dubai. Known for her strong business acumen, Carol has a proven track record of leading operating model transformations and fostering agility in fast-moving global environments. She earned a Ph.D. in Industrial/Organizational Psychology from Central Michigan University.¬† Carol is also a recognized HR thought leader, having served as Vice Chair of the HR Policy Association. She currently serves as a member of Gartner‚Äôs CHRO Leadership Board, an HR Policy Association board and executive committee member and a member of the Advisory Board of the University of South Carolina Center of Executive Succession. In 2020, she was honored as a Fellow of the National Academy of Human Resources, the highest honor granted in the human resources profession. Dave McQuarrie Chief Commercial Officer Dave McQuarrie is Chief Commercial Officer at HP Inc., accountable for all aspects of sales, go-to-market and revenue and margin generation on a global scale. The Commercial Organization is structured across eight geographic markets and six global teams, spanning Global Channel, Sales Innovation & Transformation, Digital Go-to-Market, Global Services & Solutions, Global Accounts, Lead to Cash and Go-to-Market across all HP product categories. Dave brings a breadth of leadership experience to the Chief Commercial Officer role from across the IT industry. He is a strong, customer-focused and data-driven leader who has built an impressive track record of results since joining HP in 2017. A native of Australia, Dave has lived and worked in six countries and brings a diverse set of global experiences to his role. He is also a purpose-driven leader with a growth mindset and deep commitment to the HP Way, serving as the executive sponsor of the HP disAbilities Impact Network for the past three years. Prior to his current role, Dave served as the General Manager of the Personal Systems Category, with global responsibility for profit & loss management, product management, sales management, and business planning and operations for both Consumer and Commercial product categories. Previous HP executive roles include Global Head of Customer Support and Global Head of Print Business Management. Prior to HP, Dave spent nearly a decade at Lenovo where he held business leadership positions across Europe. He also served in sales, marketing and product leadership roles for Dell across Europe and Asia. He and his family are based in Palo Alto. Ernest Nicolas Chief Enterprise Operations Officer Ernest Nicolas is Chief Enterprise Operations Officer at HP Inc. He is responsible for delivering innovative technology solutions and building a future-ready supply chain that promotes social and environmental sustainability directly tied to HP's global reputation and business growth. Ernest joined HP in 2022, bringing more than 25 years of global experience in end-to-end, integrated supply chain functions. His experience includes industrial engineering, production management, and supply chain planning with General Motors, where he was awarded the General Motors Graduate Fellowship to pursue full-time graduate study. In 2006 he joined Rockwell Automation, serving in Lean Six Sigma project management, supply chain planning, manufacturing operations, strategic sourcing, logistics as well as customer service functions in North America and Asia before being named Senior Vice President and Chief Supply Chain Officer in 2019. He serves on the Board of Directors for Avient Corporation and is an Advisory Board member for Wahl Clipper Corporation. A passionate advocate for diversity and inclusion, Ernest is a member of the Executive Leadership Council (ELC), an organization focused on advancing and preparing the next generation of diverse corporate leaders. Ernest grew up in the southern suburbs of Chicago and is married with three children. He holds an MBA in Operations Management and a Master of Science in Manufacturing Systems Engineering from the University of Wisconsin ‚Äì Madison, as well as a Bachelor of Science in Manufacturing Systems Engineering from Kettering University. Ernest is based in Houston, Texas. Dave Shull President, HP Solutions Dave Shull is President of HP Solutions. As head of this business, he integrates HP‚Äôs portfolio of hardware, services, and software to improve employee experiences, provide flexibility, and deliver peace of mind for global organizations. Joining HP from Poly, where he held the role as President and CEO, Dave brings to HP over 25 years of senior leadership experience in business transformation, complex business partnerships, operations, and corporate development having built, led, and reinvigorated brands including TiVo, Weather Channel and Dish. Dave serves as board member and advisor to a number of technology start-ups, and also supports a group of charities addressing ultra-poverty. He holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree in philosophy from Harvard University and an M.B.A. from Oxford University. Dave is based in Denver, Colorado. Tuan Tran President, Technology¬†& Innovation Tuan Tran is President of Technology & Innovation at HP Inc., an organization established in November 2024 to shape the company‚Äôs technology strategy and accelerate the implementation of AI experiences across HP‚Äôs diverse portfolio. Driven by a strong commitment to HP‚Äôs vision of leading the future of work, Tuan plays a pivotal role in delivering innovative solutions that empower HP customers to thrive in a rapidly changing environment. Throughout his tenure with HP, Tuan has held a variety of senior leadership positions across the company and helped drive innovations that have reshaped the technology landscape. His extensive experience and strategic foresight position Tuan as a key architect of HP‚Äôs future, ensuring that HP remains at the forefront of industry trends. Most recently, Tuan served as President of HP Imaging, Printing, and Solutions, a $20 billion global business that delivers services, software, and hardware for home, office, and graphics markets. Under Tuan‚Äôs leadership, HP‚Äôs printing portfolio was consistently recognized for its innovation, security, and sustainability by leading industry experts including KeyPoint Intelligence, the European Digital Press Association, and CRN. Tuan has also held roles in the Office Printing Solutions Organization, Consumer Business Organization, Mobile Computing Division, and Business Printing Division in Singapore. Tuan began his career at HP in 1991 in the Calculator division in Corvallis, Oregon, and has since held senior roles across the company, spanning marketing, finance, and operations. Tuan holds bachelor‚Äôs degrees from both the University of Wisconsin-Madison and the University of Oregon. He also holds a master‚Äôs degree in business administration in marketing, finance, and operations from the University of Oregon. He is based in Vancouver, Washington.
